  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
A legendary figure of the religious right has passed
  away. The Rev. Jerry Falwell died this afternoon. The cause of his death wasn’t
  immediately disclosed, but he’s had a history of heart trouble. 
 
In his life, he was seen as a visionary to some
  conservatives and an archenemy to liberals. Falwell leaves a legacy of
  founding the Moral Majority, bolstering the evangelical community and
  sculpting it into a major political force. Our Richard Schlesinger will tell
  the story of this influential man’s life.
 
We’ll also have a slate of in-depth interviews
  with religious leaders, academics and public figures about Rev. Falwell’s
  impact on religion and politics in America.
 
In other news, the search continues for information
  about three U.S. soldiers
  feared captured by an al Qaeda group during a weekend ambush in Iraq.
  Troops have detained 11 people and questioned hundreds in connection with the
  attack.  Sharyn Alfonsi is at Fort
    Drum, New York,
  where the troops killed and kidnapped last weekend were based. 
 
One of the savviest ways companies are reaching kids
  is through the Internet. But forget old-fashioned pop-up ads. What’s
  targeting your children is fun for them and highly profitable for the
  advertisers – it’s called “advergaming,” and John
  Blackstone will report on the phenomenon for tonight’s installment of
  “Gotta Have It: The Hard Sell To Kids.”
 
Please join us tonight for these stories and more.
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
